sag.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to hang down or bend in the middle, especially because of the weight of something
sag.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The branch sagged under the weight of the apples.
The skin around my eyes is starting to sag.
sag.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to become weaker or less valuable
sag.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: attempts to revive the sagging economy
sag.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: (Screen Actors' Guild) a trade union in the US for actors and actresses who perform in films for the cinema or television
sag.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to become weaker or to fall in amount
sag.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: The airline industry tends to sag during recessions.
